item.title: Learnings
item.description:
There is always something to learn

17th of April

Configuring R and workflow in a Mac:

  • Install Xcode in order to get git: https://osxdaily.com/2014/02/12/install-command-line-tools-mac-os-x/

  • Get key pair: https://secure.vexxhost.com/billing/index.php/knowledgebase/171/How-can-I-generate-SSH-keys-on-Mac-OS-X.html

  • Show hidden files: Cmd + Shift + .

18th of April

Each time that I open Twitter without a concrete plan afterwards, it goes on for ages. I must always have a plan in mind, one that is compatible with my daily habits. No more random Whatsapp and Twitter checking. Go back to writing one tweet each time you use it!

19th of April

How to connect to Redshift: Download VSCode. Add the extension SQLTools:https://vscode-sqltools.mteixeira.dev/. Add a Keybord shortcut for ‘Run selected query’.

The VPN might not work: In advanced Network preferences tick ‘Send all requests through the VPN connection’. Restart the computer.

Modify author of git commit: https://www.git-tower.com/learn/git/faq/change-author-name-email

20th of April

Started to work into memory, audiobook: Moonwalking with Einstein

Colombia’s oil is Brent not WTI: https://www.investopedia.com/ask/answers/052615/what-difference-between-brent-crude-and-west-texas-intermediate.asp

Docker: Runs in http://localhost:8888/

21th of April

Git: git revert Three way merge Pull requests: first goes the branch you want to merge INTO!

Memory: Associate names with memorable images to remember them easily!

22th of April

Git: Create commit with a different date: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3895453/how-do-i-make-a-git-commit-in-the-past

23rd of April

Hugo Academic theme: widget pages https://sourcethemes.com/academic/docs/managing-content/#create-a-widget-page

24th of April

German: 15:51:29 From Berit Lingoda : hat mir mein Vater vorgelesen und dann habe ich selbst angefangen zu lesen. El niño que mató 7 moscas: das tapfere Schneiderlei 15:53:30 From Berit Lingoda : lein 15:57:53 From Berit Lingoda : https://www.dw.com/de/die-vespa-ist-kult/l-49363624 15:58:52 From Berit Lingoda : https://sprachekulturkommunikation.com/deutsch-lernen/uebungen-b1-b2/ 15:59:15 From Berit Lingoda : https://learngerman.dw.com/de/grammar 16:00:08 From Berit Lingoda : https://www.deutsch-perfekt.com/deutsch-hoeren

25th of April

The cure for scurvy was found and lost some years after: https://idlewords.com/2010/03/scott_and_scurvy.htm

26th of April

Using RcppArmadillo: https://thecoatlessprofessor.com/programming/cpp/rcpp-rcpparmadillo-and-os-x-mavericks-lgfortran-and-lquadmath-error/

Watercolors art: https://fronkonstin.com/2020/03/26/watercolors/

27th of April

Sisyphus is an absurd man in his way back to the bottom of the summit. At that moment he holds no hope, but he’s in control of his own destiny, he can fully enjoy life because he’s conscious of its limitations, suffering and absurdity, and as such he can decide to fully make use of it on his own terms.

Always put your bike inside, and lock it properly, you idiot!

28th of April

Quantum Field Theory: https://web.physics.ucsb.edu/~mark/ms-qft-DRAFT.pdf

Literature about collective nation memories, such as in Portugal’s case with the earthquake??

Europe’s modern way: States present the good face and help developing nations while corporations do the dirty work without considerably stainint states in the process.

Simulation of black holes through supersonic fluids: https://twitter.com/QuantaMagazine/status/1255267856977219585?s=20

29th of April

Memory palaces for language learning: https://www.fluentin3months.com/memory-palace/

Lisbon earthquake: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1755_Lisbon_earthquake

Redshift optimisations: https://www.intermix.io/blog/3-mistakes-redshift-setup/

30th of April

Indistractable, regain focus: https://www.nirandfar.com/indistractable/

Meadow = pasture = Weide = pastos

Git, modify date of old commit: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/454734/how-can-one-change-the-timestamp-of-an-old-commit-in-git

1st of May

Angedeutet = implied, indicated. Andeuten = indicate, suggest

There are apps to save articles and read them, to control distraction and to block certain websites.

2nd of May

Prometteur = prometedor

3rd of May

Gregorius VII, the pope that excommunicated Heinrich IV, was a church reformist (and probably the one after whom we have the Gregorian calendar)

Stander = The stick for leaving the bike standing, in Dutch.

4th of May

Neu-Venedig is a town to the east of Müggelsee consistent of quite some canals. A place to be visited!

5th of May

A query to automatically create ‘create table’ statements in Redshift: https://discourse.snowplowanalytics.com/t/generating-redshift-ddl-create-statements-for-tables-that-already-exist/556

Looker extends

Jordan’s first title was in 91, after two lost finals

Colourlovers R package: https://github.com/andrewheiss/colourlovers

6th of May

Ferreteria is Hardware store in english haha, der Baumarkt, la quincaillerie.

“A need to tell and hear stories is essential to the species Homo sapiens—second in necessity apparently after nourishment and before love and shelter.” —Reynolds Price, from A Palpable God.

Graphic design for data: https://datavizm20.classes.andrewheiss.com/slides/02-slides.html#48

7th of May

Abandoned prison in Loos, close to Lille.

8th of May

einfallen -> colapsar/implosionare anfassen -> agarrar berühren -> tocar zer -> prefijo para acciones que implican dispersión/destrucción/desintegración be -> prefijo para cuando una acción implica a un “otro”, ya sea objeto o ser (es una hipótesis, falta comprobarlo)

9th of May

sarebbe bello/ottimo…, para decir estaría bien…, sería bacano…

10th of May

déceler = detectar, descubrir or = ahora bien acquitter = absolver se borner = limitarse

11th of May

smother = asfixiar = étouffer = ersticken

Redshift: Use IDENTITY(1,1) to generate unique keys (if necessary)

12th of May

German verb prefixes: https://www.fluentu.com/blog/german/german-prefixes/

legen - to lay erlegen - to kill (mostly used by hunting)

stechen - to sting erstechen - to kill someone by knife

hängen - to hang erhängen - to die by hanging (gallows)

schlagen - to hit erschlagen - to kill someone by using a dull item

13th of May

Tubes around Berlin: http://www.berlinglobal.org/index.php?the-berlin-mystery-of-the-pink-pipes

Tricks for filtering in Tidyverse: https://sebastiansauer.github.io/dplyr_filter/
